article.description: Joston Thomas and the Hawaii Warriors handed Xavier yet another post-brawl loss, relegating the reeling Musketeers to the seventh-place game in the Diamond Head Classic.
article.shortLinkText: Hawaii hands No. 15 Xavier 3rd straight loss
article.headline: Hawaii hands Xavier third straight loss since brawl
article.linkText: Hawaii sends No. 15 Xavier to third straight loss
article.story: HONOLULU -- Joston Thomas and the Hawaii Warriors handed Xavier yet another post-brawl loss, relegating the reeling Musketeers to the seventh-place game in the Diamond Head Classic. Thomas made a layup from the baseline with 0.8 seconds left in overtime to give Hawaii an 84-82 comeback victory over Xavier (No. 15 ESPN/USA Today, No. 14 AP) on Friday night, the Musketeers' third straight loss since a bench-clearing brawl Dec. 10 against Cincinnati. "I'm my mind, my heart I was thinking we're not losing," Thomas said. "No excuses. We have to pull through." Down by 15 early in the second half of the consolation semifinal, Hawaii tied it at 77 on Hauns Brereton's 3-pointer from the top of the key with 2.0 seconds left in regulation. Thomas finished with a career-high 24 points on 8-of-11 shooting and had nine rebounds. Vander Joaquim added 20 points for Hawaii (6-5), Zane Johnson had 14 and Brereton 13. The victory was Hawaii's first over a ranked team since it beat then-No. 4 Michigan State in November 2005. "We struggled defensively in the second half," Xavier coach Chris Mack said. "We're struggling offensively. We got some open looks we didn't knock down. This was as disappointing a game for as long as I've been around." On the winning play, Johnson penetrated the lane before passing to Thomas, whose right-handed shot circled the rim before falling through. It wasn't the way Hawaii coach Gib Arnold planned it. "We drew up a play where Zane comes off a screen and knocks down a jumper for us like he's done all season," said Thomas, describing the winning play. Instead, Johnson penetrated the lane before passing to Thomas, whose right-handed shot circled the rim before falling through. A desperation heave by Xavier from about 75 feet as time expired was well short. Tu Holloway led Xavier (8-3) with 26 points, Mark Lyons had 18 and Kenny Frease 13. Xavier has lost three straight for the first time under coach Mack. Lyons played for the first time since the victory over Cincinnati. He was one of three Musketeers suspended for their parts in the altercation. Holloway, who returned from his one-game suspension Thursday in a first-round loss to Long Beach State, was 4 of 8 from 3-point range and 7 of 16 overall. He also had six assists. Holloway left the game briefly with an apparent right (shooting) hand injury early in the game. Xavier opened the game on a 12-0 run and stretched the lead to 15 with 17:17 remaining in regulation. "They jumped on us pretty good and I think we were down 15 in the second half," Arnold said. "This team has some character and we're finding out who we are. We're still figuring things out." Johnson's 3-pointer pulled Hawaii to 75-74 with 3:10 to play, but Holloway answered for the Musketeers with a 3-pinter with 24 seconds. Brereton then hit his tying 3-pointer off an assist from Jeremiah Ostrowski. Hawaii took its first lead on the first possession of overtime on Joaquim's dunk. The Warriors, who rebounded from a quarterfinal loss to Auburn on Thursday, will face Clemson in the fifth-place game Sunday. The Musketeers will play Southern Illinois for seventh place.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
